title: [Item] Scapegoat's Mask
body:
**Scapegoat's Mask**  

 - **Recipe**: Aether Wisp + Kindlegem + 700 Gold = 2400 Gold  
 - 40 Ability Power  
 - 300 Health  
 - 10% Cooldown Reduction  
 - 6% Movement Speed  
 - UNIQUE Active: Creates a clone of a target allied champion that lasts 6 seconds (90 seconds cooldown). You can control the clone's movement with this item, but it deals no damage. 

A support item to confuse the enemies and protect your Marksman ^^

replies.body:
I don't know why this name seems so clever to me. But it does. Also, it seems like the perfect opportunity to upgrade Haunting Guise (a mask!) into a support item. 

We put a lot of pressure on supports already to execute properly with active items and this takes that mechanical requirement to an even higher level.  That would be my primary concern, but it's a cool idea besides. :)

Have you thought about an item that gave champs strategic stealth? Something like:

Unique active: champ becomes stealthed for 3-5 seconds. Stealth breaks upon attacking. 90 second cd. (possibly give a movespd buff if necessary)

as far as cloning is concerned, I think it'd be a great idea. Most low elo supports just build pure mage anyway, so feel that a magy item with great utility such as this would be a great way for those players to still do dmg while also providing more utility to his team.

Yah!, as is the case for a lot of ideas, we've played around with this one internally quite a bit.  During the preseason we toyed around with a support item that would grant stealth to an ally.  There are more than a handful of complicating factors.  The thing we learned right away is that people love to use it to run away/escape.

I once spoke with Xypherous once a long time ago about the idea of a support Champion who could stealth teammates for a brief time (complete with a Rengar-styled "!" to let enemies know someone is stealthed nearby). He said that it was never going to happen because stealth-on-ally destroys counterplay against heavy initiators like Malphite, Amumu, Hecarim, etc.

But if Riot's opinion on this is changing, then by all means, I'd love to see a way to stealth a teammate.

Well, with the most recent champs, they are going against previous stated philosophies. So, I wouldn't be surprised.

That being said, they ought to make this champ to where it isn't too much like Zilean (as he currently stands)
I still doubt they'll do stealth-on-ally. The mechanic is really un-fun to play against when your enemies are cloaking a power initiator and you can't see them initiate until it's too late.
Even then, opponents generally use spacing against power initiators in order to counterplay them. If they're cloaked, however, you can't zone against them, and thus the counterplay disappears.

There was a great thread recently, where somebody posited that Riot isn't going against previous stated no-nos so much as figuring out why they said they wouldn't do a thing, then figuring out how to make it work while keeping the "why" intact (e.g. Rek'Sai has global teleport *because* they figured out that adding the scream gave warning/counterplay options).

This would be a neat idea for a Zilean rework ability. Stealth is explained because you're teleported into the future.
what if it was just a selfish stealth instead? Also, defensive stats would be a no go on it as well.
You could make it so that it would only stealth if no opponent could see you (not neccessarily including wards), thereby mitigating the ability to use it to escape

Why not condition the stealth like the bonus MS on Voli's Q.  So the person only gets it if they are moving towards a visible enemy champ

that said, i fear an amumu coming out of stealth in the middle of my team

But aren't Haunting Guise's build path and cost (etc.) too impractical for Supports?

Depends!  As a mage support (Annie, Zyra) I can definitely see the appeal of a Haunting Guise. Paired with early Sorcerer Boots, you have a ton of flat penetration and therefore damage against squishies. You don't normally want to then complete the Liandry's, is what I've found.

That's because Liandrys is a garbage item on almost every single champion that deals magic damage because it costs a fortune, the mpen is the same as the haunting guises' and the burn effect is crap because it doesn't stack.  Really, the only reason you would upgrade would be to get the extra hp.  The extra 200 hp.  :o oh my so much hp NAWT
